Author: Regnar#6164
Content:
Hey @jl777c,  multi part question: can channels be used for atomic swaps, instead of waiting for confirmations the swap is completed as soon as it enters mempool?
And follow up if that's possible, any thoughts on using a mix of Gateway and Channels CC to make instant, cross chain atomic swaps for a DEX feature? Lock coins with Gateway and atomic swap the tokens?

Author: phm87#7395
Content: @Regnar when a tx enters mempool, before it is mined, it can be invalidated by another tx with higher fee that spends the same inputs. I don't know for your other questions, let's wait for jl777 reply

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: @phm87  Thanks for the reply, I understand that but assuming it's a risk you're willing to take in this circumstance (though I think double spend attempts would be frequent for atomic swaps) going off of these docs <https://developers.komodoplatform.com/basic-docs/customconsensus/channels.html> there is a method for these 'instant' before mined transactions. Just didn't know if they could be used as a method of giving AtomicDEX instant swaps of any cryptocurrency. Maybe eventually like the 0conf of BarterDEX in some way

Author: phm87#7395
Content: @Regnar they talk about replace-by-fee transaction here : http://diyhpl.us/wiki/transcripts/breaking-bitcoin/2019/mempool-analysis-simulation/ and the fun fact about antpool can also be inverted : you can mine your own block as I suggest to double spend it (and avoid to broadcast the unconfirmed tx before mining it). Whatever it is malicious behavior, I prefer to avoid any thrust in crypto

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: @phm87  Yea that was my initial thought but I found the chapter I was originally thinking of <https://docs.komodoplatform.com/cc-jl/chapter10.html> This goes much more into detail about the channels CC and preventing double spending meme pool transactions.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: channels would work for this, but the problem is that you need to establish channels between the two pubkeys that want to do a swap, unless we have an LN type of routing, but that is a mess

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i think with completion rates of atomicDEX being high enough, most swaps can be though of as "done" when it gets started, so a GUI displaying it with a clock as it completes its steps should work

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: If i remember correctly, hyperDEX has stages 1/5 etc as it processes it counts up until done. Just like a CEX deposit counter.

Author: Lumbi#8378
Content: 'Project E-dPoS¬¥ : set up a dPoS chain for the purpose of notarizing other blockchains using PoS (run by KMD and KMD assetchains) Proceeds for dPoS could be split between stakers for maintaining their stake.  Thoughts?

Author: phm87#7395
Content: @Lumbi why not directly norarizing on KMD ? (Similarly to kmdlabs) kmd tx fee is very low compared to btc and about pos/staker notarization, I wonder if you send them coins after their elections (risk that the guy run with the coins)

Author: Lumbi#8378
Content: @phm87 yes I believe that would be more economical. It is another efficency of E-dPoS.

Author: phm87#7395
Content:
Notarizations on kmd (kmdlabs) are pretty cheap, I don't have any stats but based on my tests, I guess it should be few kmd per year.
Did you take into account risk ? Risk for a pow NN is low while pos needs to use huge amounts involving risk

Author: phm87#7395
Content: If price is dumped, a risk exists: if too many pos NN dumps their coins, your nota network will be down

Author: phm87#7395
Content: BUT if you hardcode pubkey of elected pos NN and you cap the staked amount per NN, risk can be low

Author: phm87#7395
Content: But it would require developement

Author: phm87#7395
Content: This is an interesting subject. Thank you to talk about it

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: notarizing to KMD is open to anyone to create any notarization scheme that fits their project/use-case./ecosystem/consortium/etc.   some schemes will be centralized, some decentralized.

Content: ETH ideal? You're not gong to get much agreement on that around here. I've just come off two days straight of testing out the app universe in ETH. Author: yorklab#7270
Content:
@Helly88 
1.  Build a superior platform
2. Make the cost really cheap to launch a project
3. Make the cost really cheap to use
4. Now you have a thousand companies that need dPOW. Someone earlier had already explained that  a thousand companies using just one aspect of Antara will need to buy well over 1,000,000 KMD.
5. The larger companies will need lots of chains which mean they will need more KMD than the  smaller ones. REDFOX LABS is building unicorn (Large)  companies using Komodo and all those companies will be using dPOW.
6. Many of these companies will incentivize Komodo/KMD in some way. For instance: REDFOX Labs is giving Komodo 10% of their profit for development. Zaddex exchange has KMD as one of the main base trading pairs.
7. All DEX fees will be used to buy KMD.
8. 10% discount when using KMD on AtomicDEX
9. Some of these projects may monotonize KMD; like using KMD to purchase things from a store.

Any corrections/additions are welcome.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: Question about the DEX, two nodes negotiate locktime of a trade, and the length of timelocks. This can be adjusted  based on chains, can this be further extended to provide greater 51% attack protection on trades? For example, set time to have specific number of confirmations for particularly large trades so that you can ensure the lower hash chain has less likelihood of being reversed?

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: Given the value of the trade vs the 51% attack cost of a chain, could it be possible to make a large swap, move funds again and attack the original deposit? And would extending this time window be an effective defense for that?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: each node can set the number of confirmations needed before accepting the other side funds

Content: if both chains are protected by dpow, then the number of confirmations just have to be big enough to include at least 1 notarization on both sides ?
